Description: Winged figure running right, head turned left. (obverse)
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Town (Naukratis), Silversmith's Hoard (IGCH 1647), eastern part of town
Curator's comments: Attributed in 1886 by Head to the mint of Mallus, Cilicia. From the 'Silversmith's Hoard'; see Petrie's Journal 1884-5,139, where he states it was found casually and that he visited the site, but does not specify the location.

From the ‘Silversmith’s Hoard’: ‘On the east side of the town, Mr. Petrie discovered a hoard of fifteen archaic Greek silver coins, together with 42 oz. of roughly cast and cut up lumps of silver. This he supposes to have been a portion of a silversmith’s stock-in-trade.’ (B. V. Head in Petrie 1886, 64)
